analysis.heading: Roofed porches on the 1st floor
analysis.content:
How to determine if a porch is at least 50% open (using Fig 5 as an example)

Step 1: Determine the perimeter of the porch and divide it into segments that will allow a comparison of closed and open segments.

The perimeter of the porch in Fig 5 is shown below. It is the sum of segments A through G. It is 70 linear feet.
figures: Fig 5 - Roofed 1st floor porch showing isometric view and floor plan with labeled segments A through G. Floor plan shows dimensions including 24' width (F) and 14' depth (E)
